questions.question: I ............................... for a pen ............................ this composition.
questions.description: We use the present continuous to talk about actions or situations that are going on at the moment of speaking.

questions.question: She ............................. up the stairs slowly because she didn't want ............................
questions.description: We use the simple past to say that somebody did something in the past.

questions.question: Nobody ................................ that he is innocent.
questions.description: Since the verb in the subordinate clause is in the present tense, the verb in the main clause is also likely to be in the present or future tense. A past tense seems improbable. Nobody is singular and hence the verb takes the marker -s.

questions.question: Although the children were tired, they ................................... playing.
The stranger ............................... the shopkeeper to give him a glass of water because he ...................... thirsty.
questions.description: The simple past is the most normal tense to talk about the past.

questions.question: Mother .............................. busy cooking for the guests who are arriving in the evening.
questions.description: To talk about a situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present, we use the present perfect tense.

questions.question: As I ............................. my eyes, I ......................... a strange sight.
questions.description: We use the past simple to talk about two short past actions that happened at the same time.

questions.question: The sparrow ............................ away happily after eating the mango.
In spite of being very intelligent, he ............................. score good marks.
The erring students ............................... with a strict warning by the principal.
Penguins are different from other birds because they ........................... to life in the water.
